page.title: 16BUILDINGS
page.content: Today's Uplawmoor has grown naturally.In it individually designed modern houses co-exist with Lawrence houses,a row of council houses, an enclave of sheltered housing and a variety of other architectural styles. The oldest houses at Neukfoot,now slated,were 'cruck' roof cottages with roofs of unhewn tree trunks wearing thatch. The pleasant little church at the top of the hill is of plainly worked local grey freestone in a restrained Victorian style(1888).The old English style manse is now a private dwelling as a new manse of facing brick and roughcast was built in 1962. Caldwell House is a grand mansion designed by Robert Adam for the Mure family.A security firm now owns it. Caldwell Tower looks down on it all.
